title: Drawing, "Glorification of St. Filippo Neri", 1624–1706
medium: Pen and brown ink, black chalk, on cream laid paper
inscribed: Reverse, written in ink: Del Cav. Farelli
provenance: Ex-collection:  Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The saint is carried upwards, kneeling upon a cloud, and accompanied by angels, two of whom carry a lily spray and a sheet of paper. The upper outlines of windows are probably indicated below at left and at right. Reverse,  indistinct figure sketches (in black chalk)

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Glorification of St. Filippo Neri", 1624–1706.
1624–1706. Pen and brown ink, black chalk, on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2507.
